column5: Been a while since this crappie spot produced but today was the day! Tied on a clouser minnow hoping for a pike on the fly rod! 2nd cast and Bam! Fish on. Not a pike but a big fat slab!  Couple casts later,Bam! another slab! I thought, man im on'em now! Guy who was fishin a bit down the bank runs up to where i am and stomps out on the dock  to cast exactly where im casting to! Yup! Next dozen casts,when i could get a cast in, not a hit! The school spooked and....... gone! I was not happy! But i dont own the water! A bit later after he left had a nice little pike hit the clouser and chew it up! All in all a fantastic morning! Cheers!
Nice Gil . Did you use an indicator with the set up ?
No. Just fishing a weighted clouser! Stop and go strip!
Those must have been a riot on the flyord.  For their size, I don't think there is a more vicious fish out there.  I catch them on full sized spinnerbaits all the time bass fishing.
First one i caught on Jack Lake was on a Torpedo,while bass fishing! They do hit large baits at times! And yeah, it was a blast on the fly rod!

i run into these things throwing cranks against rock piles in the kawarthas. I also like catching them through the ice, but to catch em on the fly rod would be the ultimate.  Really really cool to catch crappies up shallow. I guess now is the time for that!
Hoping for a muskie up at jack lake this year!  Then moby dick! Lol!
I have been a fly rod guy since the mid  70's,  bass fishing in the weed's and bull rush's ,  if there only 1 fish in a body of water, it would be caught on a fly rod.
its true....nothing and I mean seemingly nothing can resist a fly. I dont think ive ever seen a fish turn away from one
